title: 2023 Game Awards
description: A light-hearted page that tells the audience about my gaming experience in the year of 2023. This project was created only with HTML, CSS.

title: Parallel Falling Sand Render Engine
description: This was my bachelor's thesis project. I implemented a rendering engine using OpenGL and developed a GPU-parallelized falling sand cellular automata simulation with compute shaders. Additionally, I compared various performance metrics between the sequential and parallel algorithms.

title: Cocktailel. Cocktail ingredient guessing game
description: This project was inspired by games like Wordle, Rankdle and such. Users can guess the ingredients of cocktail beverage each day they visit the site. I further utilized data provided by CocktailDB to create a page where users can explore a large database of different alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages and recipes for them.

title: Slated. Clothing brand concept website
description: This project was created for the JavaScript module final in my front-end course. The assignment was to develop a CRUD application for an e-commerce business without a backend. I created Slated, a website for selling smart-casual clothing. The page design aimed to reflect the smart-casual style, which combines formality and minimalism with a sense of coziness.

title: CodeAcademy Student Forum
description: This was my final project for the 1024 hour-long full-stack engineer course I took at CodeAcademy. For the final project I tasked with creating a forum-like website. I had the liberty to come up with the theme for the forum and the design. I decided to create a forum for CodeAcademy students, as I thought it was something the academy was missing. During the project I created a front-end and back-end apps. This project showcases all the skills I have acquired during the course.

title: Lunch App
description: I worked collaboratively with four others for three months on this project after being accepted into Sourcery Academy hosted by Cognizant. At the academy, I had a mentor who guided my team and me through the process of creating a front-end application. I learned contemporary front-end development practices used by the company and how projects are managed and executed at a professional level.
